title: Exhibit: Invented Here: A Century of Patents and Trademarks from Western Massachusetts
description:
This exhibit showcases a collection of historical patents and trademarks originating from Western Massachusetts, spanning over 100 years of creativity and entrepreneurship. From iconic innovations to unexpected creations, each item reflects the region’s creative depth and impact of local inventors and businesses. Curated by the Western Massachusetts Patent and Trademark Resource Center, the exhibit explores themes of automotive engineering, tooling, recreation, and paper manufacturing—fields in which the region has made lasting contributions.

Opening Reception: Thursday, September 17, 4-6 p.m., Science & Engineering Library.

Exhibit open most days 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.

title: Send Some Warmth at Innermission
description:
Cards, stickers, stamps and more available for you to send some warmth into the world!

 

Visit Innermission M-F 10am - 4pm for self care activities like painting, journaling, and more.

title: SES Fall 2025 Showcase: Highlighting Student & Faculty Sustainability Leadership
description:
About the Showcase

 

 

SES Fall 2025 Showcase: Highlighting Student & Faculty Sustainability Leadership 

üóìÔ∏è Thursday, December 11, 10:30 AM – 12:00 PM (EST) 

üîó REGISTER NOW: https://umass-amherst.zoom.us/meeting/register/hAwtzH-0SIOUL6oB8ualZg  

 

This hybrid, 90-minute event will highlight the student-centered impactful work happening across our sustainability initiatives by SES as well as faculty and student leaders. While student presenters and campus leaders will gather in-person, we welcome all interested faculty, students, and community members to join us virtually via Zoom! Attendees can look forward to learning firsthand about our student leaders, their projects, and calls for collaboration, support, and action. Register here and find more details below. 

 

Showcase agenda highlights include...   

üå± The Climate Literacy Program: Presented by Roisin Kirby, SES Fellow  

‚≠ê Student Leader Spotlights: Quick talks on high-impact campus projects by undergraduate and graduate student leaders from across the Colleges of Education, Engineering, Humanities and Fine Arts, Natural Sciences, and Social & Behavioral Sciences. Featured students and initiatives include:  

  • Matt L’Ecuyer on SGA Sustainability Initiatives 
  • Eva Bergloff and Maitri Chandrashekar on New2U 
  • Marie Cloherty on the Zero Waste Initiative and Facilities Management Sustainability Fellows Program 
  • Bo Kim and Aliza Fassler on the Kinney Center’s Renaissance of the Earth Fellows Program  

ü§ù Network engagement: Discussion with calls to connect, support, and be in network with these efforts.  

 

How to join remotely  

Register here – you'll receive the Zoom link in your confirmation email!

title: MS in Business Analytics Virtual Information Session
description: Join to learn more about the Isenberg MS in Business Analytics program. The session will cover FAQ's about the admissions process, curriculum, and career outcomes. We will discuss both the online model as well as the on-campus Amherst and Newton options. Register today!
description_text: Join to learn more about the Isenberg MS in Business Analytics program. The session will cover FAQ's about the admissions process, curriculum, and career outcomes. We will discuss both the online model as well as the on-campus Amherst and Newton options. Register today!

description:
We will gather every week in a safe space to chat, share our culture, and make new friends!

Thursdays, 3:30PM to 4:30PM.

Everyone is welcome!

title: UMass INFORMS End-of-Semester Party
description:
As we wrap up the Fall 2025 semester, the UMass Amherst Student Chapter of INFORMS, together with our faculty advisor Professor Anna Nagurney, is delighted to invite you to our End-of-Semester Party on Friday, December 12, at 4:30 PM, in ISOM Room N145. 

 

Please join us for a warm and lively gathering with great conversation and a delicious variety of food, including Ukrainian varenyky (pierogies), sausages, pizza, desserts, fresh fruit, and more. All are welcome.
description_text:
As we wrap up the Fall 2025 semester, the UMass Amherst Student Chapter of INFORMS, together with our faculty advisor Professor Anna Nagurney, is delighted to invite you to our End-of-Semester Party on Friday, December 12, at 4:30 PM, in ISOM Room N145. 

 

Please join us for a warm and lively gathering with great conversation and a delicious variety of food, including Ukrainian varenyky (pierogies), sausages, pizza, desserts, fresh fruit, and more. All are welcome.

title: UMass Recovery Lunch
description:
The UMass Recovery Lunch welcomes all UMass Amherst students, faculty, and staff in recovery or exploring a recovery path. (You are in recovery if you say you are in recovery).

All Recovery Lunch is held weekly on Monday's for the fall semester from 11:00am - 1:00pm.

Come to Worcester DC Room 155 (across from the grab and go), and join us for lunch (provided by us), connection, and conversation. Come in and stay for a long time or a short time.  Whatever works for you and your schedule.
description_text:
The UMass Recovery Lunch welcomes all UMass Amherst students, faculty, and staff in recovery or exploring a recovery path. (You are in recovery if you say you are in recovery).

All Recovery Lunch is held weekly on Monday's for the fall semester from 11:00am - 1:00pm.

Come to Worcester DC Room 155 (across from the grab and go), and join us for lunch (provided by us), connection, and conversation. Come in and stay for a long time or a short time.  Whatever works for you and your schedule.

title: Worcester Unplugged
description:
Join us in Worcester DC Room 155 (Across from the grab and go)  to digitally unplug and connect.  There will be music, crafts, games, and snacks.  If you sing and/or play an instrument and would like to provide music for the event, just come on down!

 

Weekly event: Monday's during the fall semester from 4:00pm-7:00pm.

 

All are welcome!

title: Faculty of Color Dinner
description: Join us for an evening of delicious food, drinks, and engaging conversation with colleagues as we come together to foster community among UMass Amherst faculty and librarians. Everyone is welcome, including partners. Please RSVP by 5 p.m. on December 4th.

title: Author Talk: Bob Blaemire
description:
Introduced by the former Director of the UMass Civic Initiative Mike Hannahan, Bob Blaemire will discuss his new book, Unforced Errors: 15 Bad Decisions That Changed American History.

Blaemire has been a participant in politics all of his adult life. For many years, he worked for Senator Birch Bayh (D-IN), who authored Title IX and the 25th and 26th Amendments. Blaemire went on to form a political action committee before beginning a long career providing political computer services for Democratic candidates and progressive organizations. An early participant in the rise of big data, he owned and managed Blaemire Communications for 17 years. Blaemire is also the author of the 2019 book, Birch Bayh: Making a Difference.

Unforced Errors will be available for purchase courtesy of Amherst Books.
